page.title: 14PRAWN FISHING FROM PLOCKTON.
page.content: THERE ARE{6 FISHING BOATS}IN PLOCKTON WHICH ALL FISH WITH{CREELS}TO CATCH PRAWNS.4 OF THEM HAVE A CREW OF 2 AND 2 OF THEM ARE SINGLEHANDED BOATS.THE CORRECT NAME FOR THE{PRAWNS}IS THE {NORWAY LOBSTER}WHICH ARE SOLD AND EATEN AS{SCAMPI.}THE BOATS FISH ALL THE YEAR ROUND,AND ARE{INSHORE}BOATS LANDING THEIR CATCH DAILY.MOST OF THE TIME THEY FISH IN LOCHCARRON OR THE INNER SOUND OF RAASAY.PRAWN CREELS ARE JOINED INTO LENGTHS CALLED FLEETS. A PIECE OF{SALT HERRING FOR BAIT}IS PUT IN EACH AND THE CREEELS SET DOWN ON A MUDDY BOTTOM,ON AVERAGE ABOUT 80m DEEP.THEY ARE LIFTED EACH DAY WITH THE HELP OF A MACHINE CALLED A{HAULER}AND SORTED INTO SIZES.(AVER. ABOUT 20cm.). A LORRY TAKES MOST OF THE CATCH LIVE TO{BUCKIE}TO BE FROZEN.THEY ARE SOLD ALL OVER{BRITAIN}OR AS FAR AWAY AS {FRANCE}OR{SPAIN.
